metadata.title: CVE-2022-20422 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In emulation_proc_handler of armv8_deprecated.c, there is a possible way tocorrupt memory due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalationof privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-237540956References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-197-generic - 4.15.0-197.208~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-197-generic - 4.15.0-197.208~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-197-lowlatency - 4.15.0-197.208~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1143-aws - 4.15.0-1143.155~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1154.169~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-gcp - 4.15.0-1138.154~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-oracle - 4.15.0-1108.119~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
